title: Exodus Chapter 25 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 25 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 25 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 25.

questions.question: What materials did the LORD ask the children of Israel to bring as an offering according to Exodus 25:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, and brass
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:3 states that the offering to be taken includes gold, silver, and brass.

questions.question: According to Exodus 25:8, why were the children of Israel instructed to make a sanctuary?
options: So the LORD may dwell among them
questions.correctAnswer: So the LORD may dwell among them
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:8 clearly states the sanctuary was to be made so that God may dwell among the children of Israel.

questions.question: What wood was used to make the ark as instructed in Exodus 25:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10 instructs that the ark shall be made of shittim wood.

questions.question: How was the ark to be covered according to Exodus 25:11?
options: With pure gold, inside and outside
questions.correctAnswer: With pure gold, inside and outside
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:11 says the ark shall be overlaid with pure gold within and without.

questions.question: How many rings of gold were to be cast for the ark, and where were they placed as described in Exodus 25:12?
options: Four rings, at the four corners
questions.correctAnswer: Four rings, at the four corners
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:12 instructs casting four rings of gold for the four corners of the ark.

questions.question: What was placed inside the ark according to Exodus 25:16?
options: The testimony which God would give Moses
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony which God would give Moses
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:16 states that the testimony which the LORD will give Moses is to be put into the ark.

questions.question: What was made on the mercy seat at the two ends according to Exodus 25:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Two cherubims of gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:18 commands making two cherubims of gold of beaten work on the two ends of the mercy seat.

questions.question: According to Exodus 25:22, where will God meet and commune with Moses?
options: From above the mercy seat between the two cherubims
At the foot of the mountain
questions.correctAnswer: From above the mercy seat between the two cherubims
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:22 specifies that God will meet and commune with Moses from above the mercy seat, between the two cherubims.

questions.question: What were the dimensions of the table of shittim wood described in Exodus 25:23?
options: Two cubits long, one cubit broad, and one and a half cubits high
Three cubits long, two cubits broad, and two cubits high
One cubit long, one cubit broad, and one cubit high
Four cubits long, two cubits broad, and three cubits high
questions.correctAnswer: Two cubits long, one cubit broad, and one and a half cubits high
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:23 gives the dimensions of the table as two cubits length, one cubit breadth, and one and a half cubits height.

questions.question: What was to be set upon the table always, as stated in Exodus 25:30?
questions.correctAnswer: Shewbread
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:30 commands that shewbread is to be set upon the table before God always.

questions.question: How many branches did the golden candlestick have according to Exodus 25:32?
questions.correctAnswer: Six branches
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:32 describes the candlestick as having six branches, three on each side.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 25:4 includes goats' hair as part of the offerings to be brought by the children of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:4 lists goats' hair among the materials to be taken as offering.

questions.question: True or False: The staves used to carry the ark were to be taken out of the rings when not in use, according to Exodus 25:15.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:15 states the staves shall be in the rings of the ark and shall not be taken from it.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 25:40, Moses was instructed to make all items after the pattern shown to him on the mount.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:40 commands that the items be made according to the pattern shown on the mount.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Exodus 25:31, the candlestick was to be made of ________.
questions.correctAnswer: pure gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:31 states the candlestick shall be made of pure gold.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 25 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 25 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with how to give generously and sincerely to God’s work. Based on Exodus 25, what biblical truth would you share about giving?
options: Give only when required by others
Give willingly and with your heart
Give to be praised by men
questions.correctAnswer: Give willingly and with your heart
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:2 teaches that offerings should be given willingly and with the heart, emphasizing sincerity and willingness in generosity. This reflects faith, trust, and obedience to God’s commands (Exodus 25:2, 25:3-6).

questions.question: How does Exodus 25 teach us about obedience in serving God through the construction of the sanctuary?
options: Follow the exact pattern shown by God
Ignore the instructions and be creative
questions.correctAnswer: Follow the exact pattern shown by God
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:9 and 25:40 instruct Moses to build the tabernacle exactly according to the pattern God showed him. This teaches obedience and reverence in our service to God, reflecting integrity and faithfulness in following His Word.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because their work in the church seems unnoticed. What encouragement about serving others can be drawn from Exodus 25?
options: God sees and values willing offerings and faithful work
Only large offerings are acceptable to God
Service should be for public recognition
Work should be done only when others supervise
questions.correctAnswer: God sees and values willing offerings and faithful work
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:2 encourages giving willingly with the heart, and the detailed instructions for the sanctuary (Exodus 25:10-40) emphasize the value God places on faithful service. This teaches that God honors sincere and obedient work, even if unnoticed by others.

questions.question: How does Exodus 25 demonstrate the importance of spiritual discipline and devotion in worship?
options: By instructing to make an ark, table, and lampstand with specific details
By allowing worship to be casual and unstructured
By focusing only on external appearances
questions.correctAnswer: By instructing to make an ark, table, and lampstand with specific details
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10-40 describes in detail the construction of the ark, table, and lampstand for the sanctuary, showing the importance of disciplined, reverent worship and devotion, reflecting God’s holiness and order.

questions.question: A person seeks guidance on humility and contentment. What lesson can Exodus 25 provide from the instructions about materials and craftsmanship?
options: Use the best materials offered willingly, honoring God
Focus on showing off wealth through offerings
Demand perfection from others without humility
questions.correctAnswer: Use the best materials offered willingly, honoring God
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:3-7 lists precious materials like gold, silver, and fine linen, given willingly by the people, showing humility and gratitude in their offerings. This teaches contentment in giving what one can and honoring God sincerely (Exodus 25:2-7).

questions.question: How does the command to make the mercy seat with cherubim (Exodus 25:17-22) teach about God’s presence and fellowship with His people?
options: God dwells among His people and communes with them
God only meets people in dreams
God’s presence is only symbolic and never real
questions.correctAnswer: God dwells among His people and communes with them
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:8 and 25:22 show that God commands a sanctuary so He may dwell among Israel, and He will meet and commune with Moses from above the mercy seat, between the cherubim. This teaches God’s nearness and desire for fellowship.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand stewardship better. Based on Exodus 25, what principle about stewardship does the construction of the sanctuary teach?
options: Stewardship involves careful, faithful use of resources given by God
Stewardship means hoarding resources for personal gain
Stewardship is irrelevant to spiritual life
Stewardship means spending lavishly without purpose
questions.correctAnswer: Stewardship involves careful, faithful use of resources given by God
questions.explanation: The detailed instructions and use of precious materials (Exodus 25:3-7, 10-22, 31-40) emphasize responsible and reverent stewardship of God’s gifts, teaching believers to honor God by managing resources wisely and faithfully.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 25 teaches that the staves used to carry the ark should be removed after each use.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:15 states that the staves shall be in the rings of the ark and shall not be taken from it, showing God’s command for consistency and readiness in service.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 25, the lampstand was to be made of pure gold and crafted as one beaten work.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:31-36 describes the lampstand made of pure gold, beaten out as one piece, emphasizing the care and reverence due in worship and service to God.

questions.question: How does Exodus 25 teach us about the role of prayer and intercession through the design of the mercy seat and cherubim?
options: The mercy seat symbolizes God's throne where He meets and communicates with His people
The mercy seat is only decorative without meaning
The cherubim are for protection only and do not relate to prayer
There is no connection between the mercy seat and prayer
questions.correctAnswer: The mercy seat symbolizes God's throne where He meets and communicates with His people
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:22 explains that God will meet and commune with Moses from above the mercy seat between the cherubim, symbolizing God’s presence and communication, which is foundational for prayer and intercession.

questions.question: A church member questions why God requires such detailed instructions for the tabernacle. What biblical principle about obedience and reverence can you share from Exodus 25?
options: God values exact obedience as an expression of reverence and faith
God prefers loose, flexible worship guidelines
The details are unimportant and can be ignored
Obedience is secondary to personal preferences
questions.correctAnswer: God values exact obedience as an expression of reverence and faith
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:9 and 25:40 command Moses to follow the pattern shown exactly, teaching that obedience to God’s instructions is an act of faith and reverence, essential for worship and fellowship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Exodus 25, the ark was to be made of _____ wood and overlaid with _____.
questions.correctAnswer: shittim, pure gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10-11 instructs the ark to be made of shittim wood and overlaid inside and outside with pure gold, indicating the use of durable and precious materials to honor God.

questions.question: How does Exodus 25 encourage perseverance through trials in the context of God's presence among His people?
options: God’s presence in the sanctuary reassures His people in difficulties
God abandons His people in trials
Trials are punishment with no hope
God’s presence is only for the perfect
questions.correctAnswer: God’s presence in the sanctuary reassures His people in difficulties
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:8 and 25:22 promise that God will dwell among Israel and meet with them, encouraging perseverance by the assurance of His continual presence and guidance through trials.

questions.question: A parent wants to teach their children about faith and trust in God’s instructions. Which aspect of Exodus 25 provides a practical example to share?
options: The detailed construction of the sanctuary and its furnishings as God directed
Building without faith or trust in God’s Word
questions.correctAnswer: The detailed construction of the sanctuary and its furnishings as God directed
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:9-40 shows the importance of faith and trust in God’s Word by carefully following His detailed instructions to build the sanctuary, teaching children obedience and reliance on God’s guidance.

questions.question: How does Exodus 25 teach about generosity and serving others within the church community?
options: By instructing the Israelites to bring offerings willingly, supporting the sanctuary’s work
By requiring offerings only from the wealthy
By focusing on personal gain rather than communal support
questions.correctAnswer: By instructing the Israelites to bring offerings willingly, supporting the sanctuary’s work
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:1-7 calls for the people to bring offerings willingly to support the building of the sanctuary, teaching generosity, stewardship, and serving the community through shared resources.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 25 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 25.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'ark of shittim wood' in Exodus 25 as a typology in the New Testament?
options: It symbolizes Christ as the bearer of God's covenant
It represents the temple in Jerusalem
It foreshadows the destruction of the Old Covenant
It illustrates the role of the Levitical priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes Christ as the bearer of God's covenant
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10 describes the ark made of shittim wood covered with gold, which typologically points to Christ who carries the new covenant (Hebrews 9:4, where the ark contains the testimony).

questions.question: Which materials were Israelites commanded to bring willingly as offerings for the sanctuary?
options: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, badgers' skins, shittim wood, oil, spices, onyx stones
Silver, brass, and animal skins only
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, badgers' skins, shittim wood, oil, spices, onyx stones
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:3-7 lists these specific materials as the offerings given willingly by the children of Israel for the sanctuary.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the sanctuary as stated in Exodus 25?
options: So that God may dwell among the Israelites
To serve as a royal palace for the king
questions.correctAnswer: So that God may dwell among the Israelites
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:8 explicitly states that the sanctuary is made so that God may dwell among His people.

questions.question: According to Exodus 25, what is the size of the Ark of the Covenant?
options: Two cubits and a half in length, a cubit and a half in breadth and height
Three cubits in length, two cubits in breadth and height
One cubit in length, one cubit in breadth, and two cubits in height
Four cubits in length, three cubits in breadth and height
questions.correctAnswer: Two cubits and a half in length, a cubit and a half in breadth and height
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10 provides the precise measurements of the ark as two and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew word 'kapporet' refer to in this chapter, and what is its theological significance?
options: Mercy seat, symbolizing God's atoning presence
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy seat, symbolizing God's atoning presence
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:17-22 describes the 'mercy seat' (Hebrew 'kapporet') as the gold cover of the ark, where God meets and communes with Moses, symbolizing atonement and divine presence.

questions.question: How do the two cherubim on the mercy seat illustrate a form of parallelism or chiasm in the literary structure?
options: Their faces look toward each other and cover the mercy seat, forming a symmetrical thematic structure
They are described in sequence without relation
questions.correctAnswer: Their faces look toward each other and cover the mercy seat, forming a symmetrical thematic structure
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:18-20 describes cherubim with faces toward each other and wings covering the mercy seat, creating a balanced symmetrical image typical of Hebrew literary parallelism.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'testimony' placed inside the ark according to Exodus 25?
options: It is the tablets of the covenant, symbolizing God's law and promise
It is a collection of prayers
It is manna from the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: It is the tablets of the covenant, symbolizing God's law and promise
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:16 and 21 mention placing 'the testimony' inside the ark, which refers to the tablets of the Ten Commandments representing God's covenant with Israel.

questions.question: True or False: The staves used to carry the ark were made of pure gold.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:13-14 states the staves were made of shittim wood and overlaid with gold, not made of pure gold.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the golden table described in Exodus 25, and how does it relate to Israelite worship?
options: To hold the showbread, symbolizing God's provision and covenant fellowship
To be a throne for the high priest
questions.correctAnswer: To hold the showbread, symbolizing God's provision and covenant fellowship
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:30 directs that the table is to hold showbread before God continually, symbolizing ongoing covenant fellowship and provision.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The seven-branched lampstand described in Exodus 25 is made of _____ and is a single beaten work.
questions.correctAnswer: pure gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:31-36 describes the lampstand as made of beaten work of pure gold, emphasizing its preciousness and unity.

questions.question: How does the detailed craftsmanship commanded in Exodus 25 reflect the ancient Near Eastern cultural context of sacred space construction?
options: It parallels the intricate artistry used in temples of surrounding cultures to honor deities
It contrasts by being very simple and unadorned
It was focused on military defense
questions.correctAnswer: It parallels the intricate artistry used in temples of surrounding cultures to honor deities
questions.explanation: The command for detailed gold overlay and specific designs (Exodus 25:11-37) aligns with Near Eastern traditions where sacred objects and spaces were elaborately crafted to honor gods.

questions.question: What does the instruction to make the sanctuary 'according to all that I shew thee' (Exodus 25:9) imply about divine revelation and human obedience?
options: It emphasizes precise obedience to divine patterns as a form of covenant faithfulness
It suggests the pattern was optional
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes precise obedience to divine patterns as a form of covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:9 and 40 indicate that the sanctuary must be made exactly as shown to Moses, underscoring the importance of faithful obedience to God's revealed instructions.

questions.question: True or False: The incense and anointing oil mentioned in Exodus 25 were part of the offerings for the sanctuary materials.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:6 lists oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for sweet incense as part of the offerings.

questions.question: The presence of the cherubim on the mercy seat foreshadows what New Testament theological concept?
options: The meeting place between God and humanity through Christ's atonement
The power of angels in heaven
The authority of the high priest only
questions.correctAnswer: The meeting place between God and humanity through Christ's atonement
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:20-22 describe the cherubim overshadowing the mercy seat where God meets Moses, which in the New Testament is seen as a type of Christ's atoning work enabling communion between God and man (Hebrews 9:5-7).

questions.question: What does the inclusion of the 'badgers' skins' and 'rams' skins dyed red' in the offerings suggest about ancient Israelite ritual and symbolism?
options: They represent purification and protection in the sanctuary's construction
They were used for food offerings
They were common household items with no special meaning
questions.correctAnswer: They represent purification and protection in the sanctuary's construction
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:5 includes rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins, which scholars understand as materials symbolizing purity, protection, and sacred covering in ancient Israelite cultic practice.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 25 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 25 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the sanctuary that God commands Moses to have made?
options: So God may dwell among the children of Israel
To store the offerings of the Israelites
To serve as a royal palace for Moses
To be a place for sacrifices only
questions.correctAnswer: So God may dwell among the children of Israel
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:8 states that the sanctuary is made so that God may dwell among the people. This reveals God's desire for a relational presence with His people (cf. Leviticus 26:11-12; John 1:14; Revelation 21:3; 2 Corinthians 6:16).

questions.question: What attitude must the Israelites have when bringing offerings for the sanctuary?
questions.correctAnswer: Willingness of heart
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:2 commands that offerings be brought willingly from the heart. Willing giving reflects the sincere devotion God desires (cf. 2 Corinthians 9:7; Proverbs 3:9; Matthew 6:21; Psalm 51:16-17).

questions.question: What material is specifically mentioned as the wood used to make the Ark of the Covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:10 specifies shittim wood for the ark. Shittim wood, also called acacia, was valued for durability and purity (cf. Numbers 24:6; Joshua 19:38; 1 Kings 6:15; Psalm 92:12).

questions.question: What covers the Ark of the Covenant both inside and outside?
questions.correctAnswer: Pure gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:11 commands that the ark be overlaid with pure gold inside and out, signifying the holiness and preciousness of God's presence (cf. 1 Kings 6:20; Revelation 21:18; Hebrews 9:4; Psalm 45:9).

questions.question: What was placed inside the Ark of the Covenant according to God's instruction?
options: The testimony (the tablets of the law)
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony (the tablets of the law)
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:16 and 21 indicate the testimony, the tablets of the Ten Commandments, were placed inside the ark, symbolizing the covenant between God and Israel (cf. Deuteronomy 10:2-5; Hebrews 9:4; 2 Corinthians 3:3; Psalm 40:8).

questions.question: What is the mercy seat and what is its significance?
options: A pure gold cover on the ark symbolizing God's mercy and presence
A wooden lid for the ark
A cloth covering for the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: A pure gold cover on the ark symbolizing God's mercy and presence
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:17 describes the mercy seat as the pure gold cover of the ark’s top. It represents God's mercy and the place where He meets His people (cf. Leviticus 16:14-15; Romans 3:25; Hebrews 9:5; John 1:17).

questions.question: What figures were placed at the two ends of the mercy seat?
questions.correctAnswer: Two cherubim of gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:18-19 commands two gold cherubim be made at the ends of the mercy seat. Cherubim are heavenly beings signifying God's holiness and presence (cf. Ezekiel 10:1-22; Psalm 99:1; Hebrews 9:5; Revelation 4:6-8).

questions.question: How do the cherubim on the mercy seat face and position themselves?
options: Their faces look toward each other and cover the mercy seat with their wings
Their faces look outward toward the camp
They sit with faces downward on the mercy seat
Their wings are folded behind them
questions.correctAnswer: Their faces look toward each other and cover the mercy seat with their wings
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:20 describes the cherubim stretching their wings upward, covering the mercy seat, facing one another toward the mercy seat. This symbolizes God's glory and presence in the holy place (cf. Isaiah 37:16; Psalm 18:10; Revelation 4:8; Ezekiel 1:6).

questions.question: Where will God meet and commune with Moses according to this chapter?
options: From above the mercy seat between the two cherubim
At the base of Mount Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: From above the mercy seat between the two cherubim
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:22 states God will meet Moses above the mercy seat, between the cherubim on the ark. This highlights God's special presence and the divine communication with His covenant mediator (cf. Leviticus 16:2; Hebrews 9:5; John 1:18; Psalm 99:1).

questions.question: What is the material and dimension of the table God instructs to be made for the sanctuary?
options: Shittim wood, 2 cubits long, 1 cubit wide, 1.5 cubits high
Cedar wood, 3 cubits long, 2 cubits wide, 2 cubits high
Acacia wood, 1 cubit long, 1 cubit wide, 1 cubit high
Oak wood, 4 cubits long, 2 cubits wide, 1 cubit high
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood, 2 cubits long, 1 cubit wide, 1.5 cubits high
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:23 gives the dimensions and material of the table as shittim wood, 2 cubits long, 1 cubit wide, and 1.5 cubits high. This table held the showbread, symbolizing God's provision (cf. Leviticus 24:5-9; Matthew 4:4; John 6:35; Hebrews 9:2).

questions.question: What is placed on the table of showbread as a continual offering before the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Shewbread
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:30 commands that shewbread be set continually on the table before God. The bread represents God's covenant sustenance and fellowship (cf. Leviticus 24:5-9; Matthew 26:26; John 6:51; Luke 22:19).

questions.question: How is the golden candlestick described in terms of its workmanship and design?
options: Beaten work of pure gold with branches, bowls, knops, and flowers
questions.correctAnswer: Beaten work of pure gold with branches, bowls, knops, and flowers
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:31-36 details the candlestick as one beaten work of pure gold with intricate decorations representing life and light (cf. Zechariah 4:2-6; John 8:12; Revelation 1:12-13; Psalm 119:105).

questions.question: How many branches come out from the sides of the golden candlestick?
options: Six branches, three on each side
Four branches, two on each side
Eight branches, four on each side
Two branches, one on each side
questions.correctAnswer: Six branches, three on each side
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:32 states there are six branches, three on each side of the candlestick. This design symbolizes completeness and perfection of God's light (cf. Revelation 4:5; Isaiah 60:1-3; Psalm 18:28; John 1:4).

questions.question: What is the total weight of pure gold specified for making the candlestick and its vessels?
questions.correctAnswer: A talent of pure gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:39 specifies a talent of pure gold for making the candlestick and its vessels, indicating the high value and sanctity of the items used in worship (cf. 1 Kings 10:14; 2 Chronicles 1:14; Daniel 2:38; Revelation 21:18).

questions.question: What principle guides the construction of the sanctuary and its furnishings according to this chapter?
options: Following exactly the pattern shown to Moses on the mountain
Using only the cheapest materials available
Adding personal artistic touches by the craftsmen
questions.correctAnswer: Following exactly the pattern shown to Moses on the mountain
questions.explanation: Exodus 25:9 and 40 command that all be made according to the pattern shown to Moses on the mountain, emphasizing divine revelation and obedience (cf. Hebrews 8:5; Numbers 8:4; 1 Kings 6:12-14; John 14:15).
